fields.description: It would be nice to have something like a status bar that showed the commands sent to the repository for each action initiated in the gui.
fields.summary: Show command line used for each operation

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Open SourceTree
2. Click on any commit with source changes.
3. Click on any source row
4. Press Ctrl + Ins/ Ctrl + C
5. SourceTree hangs for 2-3 seconds, doesn't respond on any clicks etc.
fields.summary: Copy to clipboard from source changes preview took 2-3 seconds hanging SourceTree

fields.description: TortoiseGit does provide a function to blame the previous version. It would be great to have this in SourceTree also.
fields.summary: Blame previous version

fields.description:
I'm doing a lot of searching for the right commit and the cherry-picking it into a branch. I've got about 30 commits I have to do this for. Currently, the workflow is like this:

1) Select the "Search Tab"
2) Enter my search terms
3) Find the commit I care about
4) Right-click on the commit, "View in Full Log"
5) Right-click on the commit, now visible in the full commit list, select "Cherry Pick"

What is the reason for not being able to operate on the commit from the search results window?
fields.summary: Cherry Pick from Search Results

fields.description:
When Check For Updates is started from Standard User account that doesn't have administrator privileges it fails with Access Denied error message.
When Check For Updates is started with "Run as administrator" it works as expected. I guess that adding manifest to Check For Updates app with "requireAdministrator" would solve the issue.
fields.summary: SourceTree "Check For Updates" shows Access Denied when running as Standard User

fields.description: It would be useful to include the option to include untracked files when stashing changes. The option is available in Git from 1.7.7.
fields.summary: Stash with --include-untracked

fields.description:
Want add gvim as diff tools, it's amazing good.


C:\Program Files\vim\vim73\gvim.exe  -d  -d $LOCAL $REMOTE
fields.summary: Add gvim -d for diff tools

fields.description:
In a repository with no "master" branch, trying to initialize git flow fails with this unhelpful error:

{code}
Using default branch names.
Which branch should be used for bringing forth production releases?
   - develop
Branch name for production releases: [] 
Local branch '' does not exist.
Completed with errors, see above.
{code}

In Bitbucket, I've set "main branch" in our repositories to be "develop", so when we clone we get a local develop branch but no master branch. So, initializing Git Flow fails unless we manually create a master branch first.
fields.summary: Git Flow initialization fails with no "master" branch

fields.description:
The platform that I work on causes man files to be changed just because the designer checks them out - they get signed and dated.

I only want to check in the ones I have actually modified. A date sort would be a huge help
fields.summary: A date modified column in the "Working Copy Changes" view would be a huge benefit

fields.description: I tried to Change the Diff View Font under the Options Control when I got an exception.
fields.summary: Exception when changing Diff View Font

fields.description: Manual authentication hooks are not being registered when finishing a release in Git flow, meaning that if you use the 'Push' option and manual user/password authentication is required (i.e. not SSH keys), the push part of the process will hang.
fields.summary: Git flow finish release + push option hangs with manual SSH passwords

fields.description:
Please implement some sort of manual control over submodules (maybe from the left-side list, where submodules are currently shown).

It would be quite useful to be able to execute submodule-specific tasks (init, update, sync, foreach, etc) from within SourceTree.
fields.summary: Implement manual control for submodules

fields.description:
After installing Sourcetree 0.9.4 for the first time, it keeps asking me to update to 0.9.4. Looking in the about I find it thinks it's 0.9.2.3.

Installing on top doesn't work - it asks if I want to repair/modify/uninstall. Uninstalling and re-installing or repairing suffers the same problem.
fields.summary: Sourcetree install 0.9.4 does not work correctly

fields.description:
Mark a commit description with mouse (Commit, Parents, Author, Date, Labels, Description, .... everything)

Copy CTRL+C ... Press CTRL+V => Crash
or
Copy with right click => Crash

100% reproducable

Crashdump is to big, ~ 320MB
fields.summary: Crash after copy to clipboard

fields.description:
When filtering in the file status view and "show all" is selected in the combobox,Log Selected and Blame Selected are disabled in the menu.

See the attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Log Selected and Blame selected are disabled when showing all files and filter is active

fields.description: When I choose to finish a feature, I expect that the feature branch be merged into the develop branch with a merge commit, and not a fast forward merge.
fields.summary: Gitflow, Finish Feature, Create Merge Commit

fields.description:
When trying to send a file to a custom external diff tool the external diff cannot open one of the files when there is a space in the filename.

"vsdiff: coule not find file "C:/Users/jwagner/AppData/Local/Temp/uyp09b_Non-Social"
Trying to diff a file named "Non-Social Security_small.csv"

That's because the "Arguments" need to be specified as \"$LOCAL\" \"$REMOTE\"

So the request is as follow:

It seems like this should be handled by the tool itself, rather than requiring the user to surround the values in quotes, although giving the user complete control can also be a benefit. Maybe you should just modify the helper text to read as follows:
{noformat}
Available command arguments for 'Custom': $LOCAL (= mine), $REMOTE (= theirs), 
$BASE (= common parent), $MERGED (= merge output)
Please note that you may need to surround these arguments in parenthesis to be able to 
support filenames with spaces. (i.e. \"$LOCAL\" )
{noformat}
fields.summary: Custom External Diff doesn't handle spaces in filenames

fields.description: Trying to add a Bitbucket repo. When entering the repo url, the Authenticate box comes up. As soon a the cursor enters the password box, it crashes.
fields.summary: Askpass has stopped working

fields.description: Fatal error every time I open SourceTree.
fields.summary: Fatal error:  System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException: TimeSpan period must be less than or equal to Int32.MaxValue.

fields.description:
Raised by a user who had configured SSH in SourceTree but had never set it up on the command line, so GIT_SSH wasn't defined (they were using PuTTY). This meant that remote commands didn't work in the terminal despite working in SourceTree.

Consider checking if the GIT_SSH environment variable exists in the calling environment, and if not set it on the terminal process.
fields.summary: Define GIT_SSH in terminal if not already defined

fields.description:
If there is a merge with 50 conflicting files and "accept theirs" is selected for all 50, the 50 files cannot be multi selected, right clicked and "Resolve Using Theirs".

When doing that, what happens is that the file with the mouse cursor gets resolved correctly but the 49 other files get marked resolved yet sill have the chevrons ({{<<<<HEAD >>>>>======}}) in them, thus busting the build.

The current workaround is to manually right click each file one by one.
fields.summary: Resolving Merge Conflict Is Not Applied to Multiple Selected Files

fields.description:
Typing file search query is not smooth when you have thousands of files in repository. Please add an option for disabling the real time function. 
Consider using a button or press enter when done typing.
fields.summary: Typing file search query is not smooth when Show All is selected.

fields.description:
Being a right handed, it's pretty akward to press `ctrl+shift+=` to add a file on stage. Would be nice to allow configuring default shortcuts.

Also, on the same page, configuring double click action on _working copy changes_ and _staged changes_ panels would be a nice addition. I guess is more useful to stage a file with double click, rather than open it.
fields.summary: Option to double-click to stage files

fields.description:
Would be nice to have the ability to open a git project via command line.

Something like `sourcetree c:\my-project`.

If the project is already added in sourcetree then open/focus it, if not, add it and open/focus
fields.summary: Add CLI Flags

fields.description: I clicked to upgrade Source tree.  After it finished downloading the application crashed.
fields.summary: Tried to Upgrade Source Tree

fields.description:
Hi,

When I press the "Terminal" button un the toolbar,  the app drop me to the Bash shell prompt.

I would like a way to setup "powershell" as my default "Terminal"

Have a nice day

Sébastien
fields.summary: Add the option to Choose the "shell" for the terminal

fields.description:
When my only uncommitted change is a rename, when I add the rename to the index, the "Uncommitted changes" row disappears from the log/history view. If I instead use the "file status" view, I can see the staged rename.

Reproduction steps:

1. Clone https://bitbucket.org/jennings/test.sourcetree.renaming
2. Rename foo.txt to foo2.txt
3. On the log/history view, click "Uncommitted changes"
4. Drag the addition and removal to staged changes
fields.summary: "Uncommitted changes" disappears from log/history view after staging a rename

fields.description: if this is implemented, is well hidden because I always have to drop to the console for correcting my messages before going public.
fields.summary: Add Support to modify commit message when commit is not pushed to any remote.

fields.description: When checking for and applying updates, users are prompted to provide a username and password for our proxy server.  It would be nice if this was handled behind the scenes through NTLM instead of the user being prompted.
fields.summary: Provide NTLM Support for Proxy Server authentication for SourceTree updates

fields.description: i use it pretty often to edit or squash commits. is there a way to rebase on commit that is in the same branch?
fields.summary: Missing force rebase feature

fields.description:
After every update I install for Windows SourceTree I find that my custom configuration for Diff and Merge has been lost and I have to re-enter it.  I do notice that the following lines are still present in .gitconfig but I don't know what their relationship is exactly to sourcetree configuration.   Updates to SourceTree should not clear my custom Diff/Merge settings.

{code}
[difftool "sourcetree"]
        cmd = 'C:/Program Files/Guiffy/guiffy.exe' $LOCAL $REMOTE
[mergetool "sourcetree"]
        cmd = 'C:/Program Files/Guiffy/guiffy.exe' $LOCAL $REMOTE $BASE $MERGED
        trustExitCode = true
{code}
fields.summary: Updates wipe out Custom Diff/Merge configuration

fields.description:
When installing the latest release (after closing the running instance) and after entering admin mode, the install is "very quick" but does not install the new version - remains at 0.9.2.3

Just complaining:
◾the frequency of releases is far too high
◾when starting SourceTree it takes 20sec to show - so I click usually a few times to make sure that it is started - have you guys heard of splash screens?
◾the installer should close and restart existing instances - or complain if you can't close it - all "normal" installers do that
fields.summary: Install fails

fields.description:
I keep SourceTree open together with a git bash. I found that if I ran 'git gc', it would fail saying it can't "unlink" certain files (which is unix speak for delete). 

The problem went away when I closed SourceTree, so I'm guessing SourceTree is not playing nice with git.
fields.summary: git gc (garbage collect) fails when SourceTree is open.

fields.description:
There are some of my annoyances with the new SourceTree Windows App:

* Text rendering is horrible. Every bit of every text is blurry. I know, it's WPF but i also know Visual Studio's latest versions (at least GUI parts) written in WPF and doesn't suck that much.
* When i right click on the left pane, i want to see which item i've right clicked. It should be selected. But instead "File status" is selected momentarily. This also sucks.
* Escape key does not work when i do something requires a git command to be executed. For instance after i switch a branch, i cannot press escape to dismiss that popup-ish thing.
* I can tab to anything while the popup is showing up. I can focus on files in "Log/History" tab and i can switch to see diffs of other files. Also upper tab bar is focusable. It shows a big dashed rectangle around tab bar. Keyboard navigation is a mess.
* Tab bar hover animation is bouncy. Close button and tab height have a bouncy animation but tab text have only ease in animation.
* Whole application becomes unresponsive sometimes.
fields.summary: Why it's ugly?

fields.description: With v0.9.4 default gitignore file appears to be installed. But the file is incorrect as it lists *.pch which are normal thing in iOS development. So if one is not aware, no change is versioned, which can be easily overlooked in big projects
fields.summary: Too aggresive default gitignore file

fields.description:
After startup of SourceTree the Toolbar images are missing occasionaly.

!http://img404.imageshack.us/img404/1986/sourcetree2013052715082.png!

Restarting SourceTree makes the Toolbar images reoccur
fields.summary: Toolbar images missing occasionaly

fields.description:
Followup from https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/170516/sourcetree-git-flow-hotfix-branch-merges-into-branch-develop-only:

Having the follow section within my .gitconfg-file: 
-----------
  [branch "master"]
	mergeoptions = --no-commit
-----------

results in failure using gitflow (hotfix, release, feature).

What I did:

   * Branch develop and branch master are on the same commit at the beginning
   * Created a Hotfix Branch via git flow-Button (
    This happened on HEAD of branch "release" -> OK
    fixed on hotfix branch ....
   * Finished hotfixing via git flow-Button ->
    a. Hotfix-Branch was deleted -> OK
    b. merge to branch "develop" took place -> OK
    c. switch to branch "develop" took place automatically (active branch is now "develop")
    d. merge to branch "master" took NOT place -> NOK (master is unmodified)
    e. Head of Branch 'master' is tagged with the provided tag (via git-flow dialog box)

What I expected according A successful Git branching model:

    Hotfix has to be merged to branch develop as well as to branch master. Head of Branch "master" should carry the given Tag.

=> This does not happen within sourcetree: merge from branch hotfix to branch master does not take place automatically!!

I see the same behaviour with using Release-Branches via git-Flow Button within SourceTree: Starting point of creating branch "Release" is here HEAD of branch develop (that's correct for release branches).

Finishing the release branch only merges to branch develop - merge to branch "master" does not take place ...
fields.summary: GitFlow fails with --no-commit in .gitconfig

fields.description:
Please Add CONNECT proxy supporting
git config --global core.gitproxy gitproxy

the bitbucket was blocked by chinese GFW, we can not access bitbucket via git pull or git push.
saddly we can not configure the CONNECT proxy with sourcetree client.
fields.summary: Please Add CONNECT proxy supporting

fields.description:
SourceTree crashed. I was doing nothing with it.
I openned it last night, did nothing and let it open. I put the windows in hibernation. Today I open it with no apparent problem but I had my browser open over everything else so maybe sourcetree already crashed, not sure. I spent some time with my browser, then closed it and seen the error message.

The crashdump file is too big so ask me if you want it, I'll put it on my server.
fields.summary: Crash

fields.description:
When you don't have an internet connection application crashes. Try disbling your lan/wireless and then launch. here's the stack trace:

   at SourceTree.AppRoot.CheckRestProxyAuthentication(IRestResponse resp, HttpWebRequest request, Boolean promptUser)

   at SourceTree.AppRoot.StartupCheckNews()

   at System.Windows.Threading.ExceptionWrapper.InternalRealCall(Delegate callback, Object args, Int32 numArgs)

fields.description: Version 0.9.2.3 does not have this issue. After upgrading to 0.9.3 on a machine offline, I get a crash. The log file indicates the issue is with computing the MD5 hash. Previous issues with this were due to gravatar images, but checking the user.config shows the EnableGravatar setting is False. Log file attached.
fields.summary: FIPS-compliant hash issue with md5 in 0.9.3

fields.description:
http://grab.by/mQF4
Crash report file is too huge to attach
fields.summary: source tree crashed

fields.description:
Twice now, coming out of hibernate after several hours -- more than 12? -- SourceTree has crashed. I did not report it the first time.

To reproduce (I think):
Start SourceTree
Open a solution
Hibernate the laptop (for > 12 hours?)
Power on and wait for laptop to come out of hibernation.
Unlock/login to Windows 8
SourceTree crashes without any user action or input.

Cannot attach the dump file. Even zipped it's 79MB!
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes when coming out of hibernate.

fields.description:
The new installer always asks for Administrator permissions even if the user chooses to install in a location to which they have full permissions. This is despite the fact that in Advanced Installer I picked the option 'Admin level install if user in admin, user-level install otherwise'.

I checked this with the Advanced Installer team, and it turns out that the option is somewhat badly named. What it actually does is perform an Admin-level 'All Users' install if it's *possible* to escalate to Admin, not just if the user is already Admin - this means that on Vista upwards you always get a request to escalate to Admin.

In order to truly perform a user-level install we have to add an extra dialog to the installer to let the user choose whether to install for all users, or just for themselves.
fields.summary: Add installer option to perform user-level install

fields.description: Please add Ctrl+F key in the branches window for filter branches by name and SHA
fields.summary: Please add Ctrl+F key in the branches window for filter branches by name and SHA

fields.description:
Sourcetree 0.9.2.x worked fine for me. After using the new installer, SourceTree crashed. Then I removed all of SourceTrees config files, caches, etc. deinstalled all und tried again. The clean SourceTree crashes as well. I appended the bug report. The dump file is 350Mb large. Is it necessary as well?

Regards
fields.summary: sourcetree crashes after update to 0.9.3

fields.description: It would be great to apply patches with source tree
fields.summary: Ability to apply a patch

fields.description:
Sourcetree crashed after waking computer up. Happened for the first time.

Log is attached, dump is 409mb, compressed still 75mb, so i can't upload it here. Please provide a location where i can upload it if it's necessary.
fields.summary: Crash after Wakeup

fields.description:
In the Diff tab in the Options dialog, all fields are disabled / grayed-out.

As a result, it is not possible to change e.g. the Diff View Font.
Please see attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Input fields in Diff tab in Options dialog are all disabled

fields.description: Reverse Commit does fail when the selected commit is a merge into an other branch. It does not specifiy the -m Option to set the correct parent. See attached Screenshot.
fields.summary: Reverse Commit does fail if the commit is a merge

fields.description:
Sourcetree is running. I put my computer to sleep at the end of the day. I wake my computer up in the morning, and I hear the "crash" ding immediately.

I have the crash dmp file, but it is too large to attach (367 MB).
fields.summary: Crash on waking from sleep

fields.description:
Left SourceTree open when I left work. Computer went to sleep; woke up computer in the morning and SourceTree crashed.

I have not rebooted the computer since installing SourceTree, and the .Net install wanted to reboot.

Also, dmp file is huge, so uploaded as split zip file.
fields.summary: crash on computer wakeup

fields.description: It would be great if SourceTree remembered options - e.g. checkboxes - in dialogs - for example in Git Pull (also see screenshot) as default. E.g. I always check "Include messages from commits being merged in merge commit".
fields.summary: Remember preferred options in dialogs

fields.description:
Why don't you implement hooks that are specific to source tree, but distributed along with the .git folder ? Per-host/client hooks absence is a major malfunction in all of VCS I know. It would be great if you are the first to offer alternative, even if it's not a final solution. Plus, I'm sure it won't even take you long.

Best Regards,
Alex Georgiev

P.S. All Atlassian guys rock. Seriously.
fields.summary: Implement local hooks
Git --set-upstream deprecated

fields.description:
When pulling from a remote, it fails if you have unstashed changes -- at which point the workflow tends to be "stash, re-pull, unstash, fix up any conflicts"

It would speed things up if there was an "automatically stash" option on the pull dialog (like GitExtensions)
fields.summary: Implement automatic stash/unstash when pulling from a remote

fields.description:
h3.Steps to reproduce
# Install SourceTree with UserA
# Clone a repository RepoA into the machine eg: C:\RepoA
# Create a UserB in the machine
# Switch to UserB
# Make sure that UserB can access the repo C:\RepoA
# Initiate SourceTree and open RepoA C:\RepoA
There will be an error cannot read file C:\Users\UserA\.gitconfig

SourceTree should be using global user configuration for UserB C:\Users\UserB\.gitconfig
fields.summary: Multiple Users work on same Working Copy having Problem with global .gitconfig

fields.description: Currently in the log history window of a commit we can only copy the path of one file. It will be very useful if we could select all files and copy the path of all !
fields.summary: Copy path of all files in file history

fields.description:
1. Open app
2. Maximize
3. Try to move splitter. - Not working

Workaround:
1. Open app
2. While not maximized - touch splitter - it works
3. Maximize - splitter working too.
fields.summary: Splitter between top Commit History and bottom Commit description not working in maximized

fields.description:
I'd like to have a small icon in the bookmarks column for every project which current local branch is ahead of its remote location, so easier spoken if my local changes have not yet been pushed to the remote server.

I often switch between multiple projects/bookmarks and it would be helpful so see a reminder so that I do not forget to push my changes.
fields.summary: Show icon in bookmarks if current local branch is ahead of head on remote

fields.description:
Every time SourceTree is launched, the "Load SSH Key?" prompt is displayed, even if the SSH key path is configured in Options. After selecting 'No' on the prompt, the configured SSH key appears to be used anyway.

I was initially using Plink after first installing SourceTree but later switched to OpenSSH when that feature was added.
fields.summary: Use configured SSH key rather than prompting at boot up

fields.description:
If one or more files are deleted and no other changes are made to a checked out branch, there is no "uncommitted changes" node. To see which files were deleted, the "Working Copy" view under File Status must be opened.

As soon as something else changes, such as a new file added or an existing file modified, the uncommitted changes node appears, complete with the deleted file(s).

The deletion(s) should cause the uncommitted changes node to be created and displayed in the branches view.

Affects 9.2.3 and 9.3.0 on Windows.
fields.summary: Just deleting files doesn't show up as uncommitted changes in branch view

fields.description:
When I try to clone a git repository from a ssh server on our local network I get the following error :-
   Unable to open connection

   Unable to open serial portfatal: Could not read from remote repository

I can clone the repository from the commandline. Dragging the cloned repository folder into SourceTree shows me the repository details, but I get the same error again when I try to fetch or pull that cloned repository in SourceTree. Cloning a repository from GitHub (using https) works in SourceTree. I have installed SourceTree on 3 other computers and they all work without a problem. What can I do to investigate further?
fields.summary: "Unable to open connection" / "unable to open serial port" on cloning from local SSH server

fields.description:
Have never used SourceTree before.
* Installed .NET framework 4.5 with Microsoft's stand-alone redistributable (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=225702)
* Installed SourceTree 0.9.3
* Started SourceTree and completed the Welcome / Setup
* The main SourceTree window pops up but is immediately unresponsive, the crash dialog popping up a few seconds later

The computer is on a development network which is connected to other development machines and the repository but otherwise has no connection to the internet.

fields.description: I was looking for an older commit with a specific SHA. I used the Jump to commit feature. But currently SourceTree does only check the items, which are in the list. SourceTree should also scan commits which are currently not in the log view.  SourceTree for Mac does support this.
fields.summary: Add spinner / progress while Jump To... is working

fields.description:
My laptop was asleep, when I started it back sourcetree had the crash dialog up. I'm not actually sure those are related.
My SourceTree_CrashReport.dmp file is 414 MB, 130 zipped so I cannot attach it.
fields.summary: sourcetree crashed on resume

fields.description:
Using Windows 7 SP 1.

Last night I was doing something when my work laptop, closed and asleep, awoke on its own volition, made an error beep, and went back to sleep again. This morning I opened the laptop to find SourceTree had crashed. No indication whether SourceTree was the cause or the victim of this awakening.

With a creation time of last night's events, the attached log file shows a looping IOException:

bq. 2013-05-07T10:20:23: Error downloading image: http://www.gravatar.com/avatar/4bad2aeeedb861eb0f1bde039adb3028?s=80&d=identicon: System.Net.WebException: An exception occurred during a WebClient request.
bq. System.IO.IOException: The process cannot access the file 'C:\Users\woram.DS\AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree\cache\img\www.gravatar.com__avatar_4bad2aeeedb861eb0f1bde039adb3028_tmp' because it is being used by another process.

In addition, the dump file (I won't attach it because it's 400MB...) report states 'The thread tried to read from or write to a virtual address for which it does not have the appropriate access.'
fields.summary: Repeating IOException causes crash

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# cherry-pick a commit that results in a conflict
# solve conflict
# hit commit button

Actual: Commit message textbox is empty 
Expected: The auto generated commit message (by Git) in the commit message textbox

If doing step 3 with TortoiseGit, the generated commit message is shown correctly. So SourceTree is just not filling the textbox correctly I assume.
fields.summary: Autogenerated commit message is not shown after a conflict after cherry picking

fields.description:
I added some repositories to my bookmarks and suddenly SourceTree would crash on startup.

After removing the broken repository from my bookmarks.xml and opentabs.xml the problem went away.

The following error caused me to find and remove this repository.

2013-05-19T19:35:59: Fatal error: 
System.ArgumentException: De mapnaam /cygdrive/c/Users/Ezra/Documents/Programmeren/PHP/thechiefs/.git/modules/public/wp-content/plugins/EzSecurity is ongeldig.

2013-05-19T19:35:59: Stack trace: 
   bij System.IO.FileSystemWatcher..ctor(String path, String filter)
   bij System.IO.FileSystemWatcher..ctor(String path)
   bij SourceTree.Utils.RepoMonitor.NewFileSystemWatcherForPath(String dir)
   bij SourceTree.Utils.RepoMonitor.AddWatchedDirectory(String dir)
   bij SourceTree.Utils.RepoMonitor.SetWatchedDirectories(IEnumerable`1 newDirs, Boolean cleanStart)
   bij SourceTree.ViewModel.RepoTabContainerViewModel.AddOrActivate(String path)
   bij SourceTree.AppRoot.OpenRepoInTab(String path)
   bij SourceTree.ViewModel.RepoTabContainerViewModel.ReopenTabs()
   bij SourceTree.AppRoot.DoWindowStartupTasks()
   bij SourceTree.ViewModel.MainWindowViewModel..ctor()
   bij SourceTree.MainWindow..ctor()
   bij SourceTree.AppRoot.OnStartup(StartupEventArgs e)
   bij SourceTree.App.OnStartup(StartupEventArgs e)
   bij System.Windows.Application.<.ctor>b__1(Object unused)
   bij System.Windows.Threading.ExceptionWrapper.InternalRealCall(Delegate callback, Object args, Int32 numArgs)
   bij MS.Internal.Threading.ExceptionFilterHelper.TryCatchWhen(Object source, Delegate method, Object args, Int32 numArgs, Delegate catchHandler)
fields.summary: Fatal error caused by invalid mapname.
Internationalization

fields.description: When I'm going to do a branch merge, I want to have an option to do a git merge --squash instead of a normal merge.
fields.summary: A option to do a git merge --squash

fields.description:
Authentication error when using email as username to login to Git server.

Have tried adding the email as part of the URL too:
http://klfoong%40atlassian.com@localhost:7990/path/to/repo
fields.summary: Couldn't use email as username to login to Git server

fields.description: It would be really interesting if we have the software GUI in other languages than English.
fields.summary: Translate GUI for multiple languages.

fields.description: When you right click an untracked file and choose "Ignore...", one of the options is "Ignore everything beneath" which lets you choose a directory. However, Windows path separators (backslashes) are often mixed into the ignore pattern. It should only have forward slashes for path separation.
fields.summary: "Ignore everything beneath" uses Windows path separators

fields.description:
Hi.
I still don't understand why all the Git client software still thinks that everyone programmes in his local machine?!  Nowadays various technologies improve and changes so fast that many IT solutions have such implementations and configurations of the technical and software infrastructures which are impossible to have in their local PCs or Macs. It is obvious that their DEV environments have to be similar to the production ones. And yes they code remotely. 
As I understand you use GIT/Mercurial output and interpret it. So As an option we could choose a repository in local drive, o to enter an SSH user, pass/private key (or pageant protocol). So SourceTree could communicate through SSH tunnel using the same git commands and getting the same git output.
IT IS ABSOLUTELY MUST BE IMPLEMENTED!  

Great work by the way ;) Very sad I can't use it :(

Audrius
fields.summary: ability to have a local branch in remote machine

fields.description: realy missing this feature. the only way I can log file is by finding the commit in witch that file was commited. that is very uncomfortable. maybe you can do a repository browser, or integrate some functions of sourcetree to windows shell (like tortoiseGit) or find other more user-friendly solution.
fields.summary: Need a way to log the file (files) from repo!

fields.description: It woul be great if you indicate the current tag when you have checked out a tag. Just like when you checkout a branch
fields.summary: Indicate current tag

fields.description:
# Open SourceTree
# Click Jump To, then Commit
# Enter a partial or full SHA, but add a space at the end
# Click OK, see commit was not navigated to

Repeat the steps but don't add a space and the commit is jumped to as expected.

This also happens with a space in front of the SHA.
fields.summary: Jump to Commit doesn't handle trailing or leading whitespace

fields.description: A normal Viewer for Blame does have a goto line and a search function. SourceTree currently doesn't.
fields.summary: Blame Viewer does not provide a goto line and search function

fields.description: Extend the amount of recent commit messages in the commit dialog. Maybe you can add a setting for it in the options dialog with a default value.
fields.summary: Increase amount of recent commit messages

fields.description:
A feature that would auotmatically show the newest (bottom) line as it is loading, or checking out files, would be nice.

Note, you must check "Show Full Output" if you do not have it enabled by default.
fields.summary: Auto-Scroll "Show Full Output"

fields.description:
When creating a new commit, I would like to grab some information from the environment and generate a stub commit message. In my particular case, I want to prefix the message with the last part of the branch name - which happens to be our JIRA number. Having the number in the commit msg makes tracking and reviewing much easier, and auto-generating it makes happy programmers.

Workflow:
* Press commit button
new: * System calls a generate hook, similar to prepare-commit-msg which generates a file somewhere
new: * System picks up this file and injects it into commit msg textbox
* User fills in commit message and commits as now.
fields.summary: Add support for generated commit messages.

fields.description:
http://screencast.com/t/C92dN7Egflrp

It is hard to select the file i would be interested into as illustrated in the video
fields.summary: 'strange selection issues when re-sorting'

fields.description: At the moment there is no possibility to override the default home directory : <user-home>\AppData\Local\Atlassian\..
fields.summary: Override User Directory

fields.description: When staging files for a project before a commit you have to drag and drop all files you wish to push to the git repo. Instead for a more streamlined approach you could have a stage all changed button which stages any files that have been changed from the original. You could then remove any files that you didn't want changed, and leave the ones you wish to push.
fields.summary: Stage all changed files feature

fields.description:
This crash occurred after I attempted to delete a remote branch (which consequently appeared to fail due to a possible access restriction) --- it wasn't until I hit the 'expand' arrow an a remote repository under a 'release' folder that the app crashed.

My crash dump is about 400 MB currently --- so it's not included -- I can try to purge and recreate the crash if that's needed.
fields.summary: Crash Occured After Attempting to Delete a Remote Branch

fields.description:
When i add ssh key from N:\My Documents\.ssh\id_rsa it does't get installed because my clone is not working and when i restart SourceTree it asks again to add a key.
When i move my key to N:\.ssh\id_rsa it's working. I also see then a short moment a black DOS window running a script. I don't see that when i use N:\My Documents\.ssh as location. Something to do with the space in the directory name?
Running Windows version 0.9.3
fields.summary: Add SSH key in Windows 7 not working if space in folder name

fields.description: Right now the parsing algorithm doesn't cope with submodules which have a '.' in their name, fix this.
fields.summary: Support submodules with '.' in their names

fields.description:
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/168110/gitflow-finish-feature-with-rebase-doesn-t-work-win

This happens whether there are conflicts or not. I hadn't spotted this because my embedded git version had a symlink laying around which let 'git flow' resolve - in fact that can't work because we avoid having to alter the user's Git install by running the git-flow script in-place. We will probably need to alter the git-flow script to resolve this, even though we deliberately try to avoid that to ensure compatibility with command-line installs.
fields.summary: Git-flow finish feature with rebase option fails at nested git-flow call

fields.description:
I saw following in "Show Full Output" section after clicking
Git-flow -> "Finish Feature" with rebase enabled.
"sh.exe C:\Users\AGOLIKOV\AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree\gitflow_local\gitflow\git-flow feature finish -r CSI-456-report-logo-reuse
git: 'flow' is not a git command. See 'git --help'.

Did you mean one of these?
	reflog
	show





Finish was aborted due to conflicts during rebase.
Please finish the rebase manually now.
When finished, re-run:

    git flow feature finish 'CSI-456-report-logo-reuse' 'develop'



Completed with errors, see above."

"git: 'flow' is not a git command. See 'git --help'." - looks not right as for me.
fields.summary: Git-flow "Finish Feature" error with rebase enabled.

fields.description:
h3.Steps to reproduce
# Clone a repository with SourceTree
# Go to {{Settings >> Advanced}}
# Uncheck "Use global user settings"
# Change the Full Name and Email address to be different from the global settings
# Click OK to save the settings
# Check the user tag in {{repo_path/.git/config}} file to confirm the changes
# Go to {{Settings >> Advanced}} again
# User information is showing global user settings 
# Without modifying anything, click OK
# The user tag in {{repo_path/.git/config}} file has changed

SourceTree should display the user information from {{repo_path/.git/config}} file, not the global user settings.
fields.summary: Git Advanced setting does not show the user information from Git config file

fields.description:
Would it be possible to get a feature to allow users to pop-out repository tabs and status/commit dialogs into a separate window?

I often like to review my history when committing. Sometimes I might have two projects with similar files of which I might want to side-by-side compare versions. Additionally, if there could be a setting to make this behaviour a default would be awesome!

Being able to view more than 1 repository at a time on my Mac is great, but it could also use the ability to pop-out the commit dialog (I'm assuming I'd have to raise an issue for this over on it's project though)

Thanks.
fields.summary: Add button and/or default setting to pop-out tabs/windows.

fields.description: I have two branches, "develop" and "development". I try to make it a *git flow* repo, and I select the default settings, so "develop" for the development branch. After clicking OK, I get a screen with status text asking which version to use, "develop" or "development", even though I selected "develop". Ultimately it *selects a blank name for the development branch*, and +fails+. There is no option to chose one.
fields.summary: Initialize Git Flow repo, confused by two similar branches.

fields.description: Besides the "All Branches" and "Current Branch" filters, it would be nice to have a "Selected Branch" filter that just displays the commits of the branch that's currently selected in the panel to the left. In the same context it would probably make sense to rename "Current Branch" to something else because it's unclear whether it refers to the currently checked out branch or the currently selected branch (initially I though it would already be the feature I'm asking for and refer to the currently selected branch). Maybe something like "Work Branch" or Checked-out Branch" would be a good name.
fields.summary: Show history for selected branch only

fields.description:
Please add control menu to tab.

[close right tab]
[close all tab]
etc...
fields.summary: Tab Contoroll Menu

fields.description:
When looking at "Log/History", commit messages with utf8 umlauts are not displayed correctly.

I think the screenshots (taken from sourcetree and from gitk) make it obvious.
fields.summary: Commitmessages with utf8 umlauts not displayed correctly

fields.description: About dialog links to 7zip's license. There is an extra whitespace inside the parentheses.
fields.summary: About dialog shows extra whitespace at 7zip license
